@graph.caption: Close up of Pavlova topped with cream and berries

@graph.name: Pavlova!! | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: Crisp delicate meringue on the outside and marshmallow on the inside. Classic Pavlova recipe with foolproof tips that make all the difference - perfect Pav, every time!

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Pavlova!!
@graph.description: Recipe video above. A classic Aussie Pav recipe with my tips that make all the difference, especially during hot humid summers which make Pavs prone to collapsing during or after baking. Top your Pav with whatever fruit you want!
recipeIngredient: 150 ml / 5 oz  egg whites (4-5 eggs fridge cold eggs) (Note 1)
1 1/2 cups / 375 ml  thickened cream / heavy cream (any whipping cream)
Fruit of choice. I used: raspberries, blueberries, strawberries and cherries.

recipeInstructions.text: Separate the whites and yolks while eggs are cold. Measure 150 ml/5oz egg whites (140 - 160ml is ok).
recipeInstructions.name: Separate the whites and yolks while eggs are cold. Measure 150 ml/5oz egg whites (140 - 160ml is ok).

recipeInstructions.text: Set whites aside to come to room temperature.
recipeInstructions.name: Set whites aside to come to room temperature.

recipeInstructions.text: Place whites in a bowl. Use a stand mixer (I use speed 7) or handheld beater (high) and beat until soft peaks form (Note 2)
recipeInstructions.name: Place whites in a bowl. Use a stand mixer (I use speed 7) or handheld beater (high) and beat until soft peaks form (Note 2)

recipeInstructions.text: Add sugar 1 tbsp at a time, beating as you go. (Note 3)
recipeInstructions.name: Add sugar 1 tbsp at a time, beating as you go. (Note 3)

recipeInstructions.text: After adding the sugar, beat for a further 3 minutes or until thick and glossy. Rub a little of the fluff between your fingers, there should be no sugar grit - that means it is ready.
recipeInstructions.name: After adding the sugar, beat for a further 3 minutes or until thick and glossy. Rub a little of the fluff between your fingers, there should be no sugar grit - that means it is ready.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cornflour and vinegar, beat on low for 5 - 7 seconds (or fold through with spatula) until just mixed through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cornflour and vinegar, beat on low for 5 - 7 seconds (or fold through with spatula) until just mixed through.

itemListElement.text: Get the base of a springform cake pan (24cm/9.5" or larger) and turn it upside down. Dab meringue on the edge and place a piece of baking paper (parchment paper) on top.
itemListElement.name: Get the base of a springform cake pan (24cm/9.5" or larger) and turn it upside down. Dab meringue on the edge and place a piece of baking paper (parchment paper) on top.

itemListElement.text: Gently place half the fluff onto the paper. Use the cake pan as a guide to make it round and coax it into a circle shape around 20cm / 8" in diameter (Note 5).
itemListElement.name: Gently place half the fluff onto the paper. Use the cake pan as a guide to make it round and coax it into a circle shape around 20cm / 8" in diameter (Note 5).

itemListElement.text: Carefully scoop out the remaining fluff. Now coax it into a dome shape (not a cake with straight smooth sides) with edges sloping in slightly. Flatten top. Make it 4-5cm / 2 " high - not much higher. (Note 5). See video / photos in post. It will rise/expand.
itemListElement.name: Carefully scoop out the remaining fluff. Now coax it into a dome shape (not a cake with straight smooth sides) with edges sloping in slightly. Flatten top. Make it 4-5cm / 2 " high - not much higher. (Note 5). See video / photos in post. It will rise/expand.

itemListElement.text: Transfer to baking tray. CAREFULLY place in the oven, GENTLY close the door and turn oven DOWN to 100C/210F (fan / convection) / 115C/240F (standard).
itemListElement.name: Transfer to baking tray. CAREFULLY place in the oven, GENTLY close the door and turn oven DOWN to 100C/210F (fan / convection) / 115C/240F (standard).

itemListElement.text: Bake for 1 1/2 hours - no peeking, no thundering through kitchen! (Note 6)
itemListElement.name: Bake for 1 1/2 hours - no peeking, no thundering through kitchen! (Note 6)

itemListElement.text: Turn oven off, leave the door closed and leave Pav in the oven overnight to cool (I've done 18 hours).
itemListElement.name: Turn oven off, leave the door closed and leave Pav in the oven overnight to cool (I've done 18 hours).

itemListElement.text: Transfer Pav to serving platter then slide cake pan out from underneath. Use butter knife if required to loosen edges from paper, then slide paper out from underneath.
itemListElement.name: Transfer Pav to serving platter then slide cake pan out from underneath. Use butter knife if required to loosen edges from paper, then slide paper out from underneath.

itemListElement.text: Just before serving, top with cream and fruit of choice.
itemListElement.name: Just before serving, top with cream and fruit of choice.

itemListElement.text: Serve and be a rock star!
itemListElement.name: Serve and be a rock star!

itemListElement.text: Place cream, sugar and vanilla in a bowl. Beat cream until it is thickened and just holds its shape - don't overbeat, it should be silky smooth, not speckled with bubbles and stiff.
itemListElement.name: Place cream, sugar and vanilla in a bowl. Beat cream until it is thickened and just holds its shape - don't overbeat, it should be silky smooth, not speckled with bubbles and stiff.
